page.title: 11Cardinham Woods,Cardinham
page.content:
Cardinham Woods covers 260 hectares.It consists of several deep sided valleys from 200 to 500 metres above sea level each with a stream running through the bottom leading to Cardinham Water which flows to the River Fowey.
The forest has probably always been here as a deciduous wood,while the Forestry Commission has been involved since 1922.Deciduous trees have been left growing particularly round the river walks and if they seed themselves elsewhere they are left to grow among the fir trees to give variety to the scenery.
